abstract.p: US and Russia will meet in first round of Davis Cup in 1998 (S)

block.p: Three years after they faced each other in the Davis Cup final, the United States and Russia will meet again in the first round of the cup in 1998.
The countries were paired in yesterday's world group draw in London, with the United States playing host to the matches April 3-5.

The United States defeated Russia, 3-2, in the 1995 final in Moscow as Pete Sampras helped account for all the team's points, beating Andrei Chesnokov and Yevgeny Kafelnikov in singles and teaming with Todd Martin for a doubles victory over Kafelnikov and Andrei Olhovskiy.
Jim Courier withstood the attacking play of an 18-year-old wild card from Thailand, beating Paradorn Srichaphan yesterday in the first round of the Heineken Open in Singapore.
''He came out firing on all cylinders,'' Courier said of Thailand's No. 1 player.
''I was really tight and he kept on bombing balls at me and he wasn't making any errors.
French Open champion Gustavo Kuerten was eliminated at the $800,000 CA Trophy tournament in Vienna, Austria, yesterday, joining the top two seeds who were beaten in the opening round.
Swiss teenagers were big winners yesterday at the Porsche Cup in Filderstadt, Germany, with Martina Hingis and Patty Schnyder advancing to the quarterfinals of the $450,000 tournament.
